pullRequest.title: Fix rounding composite aggs on sorted index
pullRequest.bodyText:
This commit fixes a bug on the composite aggregation when the index
is sorted and the primary composite source needs to round values (date_histo).
In such case, we cannot take into account the subsequent sources even if they
match the index sort because the rounding of the primary sort value may break
the original index order.
Fixes #57849

commit.message:
Fix rounding composite aggs on sorted index

This commit fixes a bug on the composite aggregation when the index
is sorted and the primary composite source needs to round values (date_histo).
In such case, we cannot take into account the subsequent sources even if they
match the index sort because the rounding of the primary sort value may break
the original index order.

Fixes #57849

nodes.bodyText: It's probably worth explaining why. I think it is because the rounding "squashes" many values together so we can't get the order of the sub-values by looking at any one key. We'd have to merge all the values that round to that key and get the sub-values from that. And that isn't the kind of this this index sorting optimization does.
